Package main.tests

Class ElevatorSubsystemTest

java.lang.Object
main.tests.ElevatorSubsystemTest
public class ElevatorSubsystemTest
extends java.lang.Object
Test Elevator Subsystem. TESTS MUST BE RUN INDIVIDUALLY (SOCKET ERRORS). THESE TESTS DEPEND ON TIME.
Author:
Tony Zeidan, Evan Lloyd, Shaopeng Liu, Leenesh Kumar, YouHeng Zhou, Dominic Motora

  • Constructor Details

    • ElevatorSubsystemTest

      public ElevatorSubsystemTest()

  • Method Details

    • testMotorErrorFlag

      public void testMotorErrorFlag() throws java.io.IOException, java.lang.InterruptedException
      Tests the flags that are set within the elevator upon receiving a message from the scheduler with errors in it. Algorithm: Make a mock scheduler that sends an error message back to the elevator. Ensure that the flag is set. Since this process takes time, wait a little bit. This flag ensures that sometime in the future, the motor error will happen.
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException
      java.lang.InterruptedException

    • testDoorErrorFlag

      public void testDoorErrorFlag() throws java.io.IOException, java.lang.InterruptedException
      Tests the flags that are set within the elevator upon receiving a message from the scheduler with errors in it. Algorithm: Make a mock scheduler that sends an error message back to the elevator. Ensure that the flag is set. Since this process takes time, wait a little bit. This flag ensures that sometime in the future, the door error will happen.
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException
      java.lang.InterruptedException

    • testHanldeMotorError

      public void testHanldeMotorError()
      Tests the handling of the motor error state. These are timed events so they can not be tested 100%.
